channel.title: Kaggle on Tristan Berchoux
channel.description: Recent content in Kaggle on Tristan Berchoux

item.title: Sunday data/statistics link roundup (12/2/12)
item.description: An interview with Anthony Goldbloom, CEO of Kaggle. I’m not sure I’d agree with the characterization that all data scientists are: creative, curious, and competitive and certainly those characteristics aren’t unique to data scientists. And I didn’t know this: “We have 65,000 data scientists signed up to Kaggle, and just like with golf tournaments, we have them all ranked from 1 to 65,000.“ Check it out, art with R!

item.title: Sunday data/statistics link roundup (6/10)
item.description: Yelp put a data set online for people to play with, including reviews, star ratings, etc. This could be a really neat data set for a student project. The data they have made available focuses on the area around 30 universities. My alma mater is one of them. A sort of goofy talk about how to choose the optimal marriage partner when viewing the problem as an optimal stopping problem.
